primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Gravel Fever land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Gravel Fever? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Gravel Fever scored 46 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Gravel Fever. Châtellerault, France. 65 mi. French countryside rolling gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. 2025 conditions were cold and wet with "no more than 12°C outside" during the day and night temperatures requiring thermal gear. Experience. 3 out of 5. Memorable course. Has character. Three-day festival format with multiple distances from 80km to 150km gives you options beyond just suffering once. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Multiple distance options from 50km to 500km create "a gravel festival for everyone" with food trucks and free entertainment. Value. 3 out of 5. Reasonable price for what's offered. Entry includes GPS tracking, luggage transport from Meudon to Châtellerault, drop bag service to checkpoints, accident insurance, free guarded bike parking, and comprehensive checkpoint support. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Your road bike might survive. Might. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Some ups and downs. Manageable. The section between CP1 and CP2 through the Perche and Alpes Mancelles features "long climbs including the Belvédère de Perseigne" according to KHS91.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Some interesting terrain. Mostly familiar. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Building a name. Not there yet. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Enough competition to keep you honest. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Affordable. Won't break the bank. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: French Countryside Rolling Gravel. If you're in France/Europe and want a local event. yes, it's solid. If you're international. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.
